ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my writing a lot over the course of English 120. I also learned a lot just through reading the essays.

The ability to take a complicated, unclear story, and think about it for a bit and finally distill it into a clear essay. I think I also gained in terms of my writing intuition and putting my personality into my writing.

I would say that by far the most influential part of this class in my writing was the use of the drafting process. Professor Caplan walks students through the drafts with incredibly thoughtful and helpful feedback at each point. This made me think more deeply about my writing and I believe improve throughout the semester. The structure Professor Caplan provided for analysis of essays was also a new lens for me that I continue to use/ponder outside of the course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: The structure of the course is very predictable in a good way. You really know what to expect and can feel comfortable and enjoy the learning process. Weaknesses: none

Strengths: engaging discussion, good workload to improve writing without being too much of a burden, great essay topics, great feedback from Professor Caplan
Weaknesses: not enough engagement with the content of the essays rather than the structure, I think too great of an emphasis on New Yorker articles over literary essays
The course was a good amount of work but very well taught and structured  I would take it again in a heartbeat.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: HIGHLY RECOMMEND! Very good first English course at Yale and gives you a very solid footing for writing in the future. The class is also small which is nice for getting personalized feedback. Also, PLEASE take this course with Lincoln Caplan. You wont regret it. He cares so much about you and your writing and he provides incredible feedback.

Yes. It's a great class to improve your creative writing, the skill of writing essays that don't have an obvious outline when you begin to think about them, and where most of the work will have to be done by your own ability to put together your own thoughts rather than group together sources of evidence.
Yes! The course is intellectually stimulating and again Professor Caplan is a terrific teacher.
